questions.question_text: What is an example of Salesforce's Trusted AI Principle of Inclusivity in practice?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Testing models with diverse dataset

Selected Answer: C
C. Testing models with diverse datasets

questions.question_text:
A customer using Einstein Prediction Builder is confused about why a certain prediction was made.

Following Salesforce's Trusted AI Principle of Transparency, which customer information should be accessible on the Salesforce Platform?

discussion.content: c. An explanation of the predictions rationale and a model card that describes how the model was created

Selected Answer: C
C. An explanation of the prediction's rationale and a model card that describes how the model was created

choices.B: A marketing article of the product that clearly outlines the product’s capabilities and features
choices.C: An explanation of the prediction's rationale and a model card that describes how the model was created
choices.A: An explanation of how Prediction Builder works and a link to Salesforce's Trusted AI Principles

questions.question_text:
An administrator at Cloud Kicks wants to ensure that a field is set up on the customer record so their preferred name can be captured.

Which Salesforce field type should the administrator use to accomplish this?
Which type of bias results from data being labeled according to stereotypes?

discussion.content:
B: Labeling data based on stereotypes is an example of association bias
https://trailhead.salesforce.com/es/content/learn/modules/responsible-creation-of-artificial-intelligence/recognize-bias-in-ai

Selected Answer: C
C. Financial status

questions.question_text:
Salesforce defines bias as using a person's immutable traits to classify them or market to them.

Which potentially sensitive attribute is an example of an immutable trait?
